thread.title: Bulldogs tabbed to win AAC Regular Season Championship
thread.title_full: Bulldogs tabbed to win AAC Regular Season Championship

title: Bulldogs tabbed to win AAC Regular Season Championship
text:
Bulldogs tabbed to win AAC Regular Season Championship Posted: Tue 3:43 PM, Oct 20, 2015 / Headlines List / Article 
BARBOURVILLE, Ky. â€“ The Union College women's basketball team is narrowly favorited to win 2015-16 Appalachian Athletic Conference Women's Basketball Championship, according to the AAC Coaches' Poll released on Monday. 
Coming off a 19-9 record in 2014-15, the Bulldogs received two of the 11 possible first-place votes but collected 107 total voting points to claim the top spot. Head coach Tim Curry returns 14 players from last season's team, including six of top eight scorers from a season ago. 
Tennessee Wesleyan received six first-place votes and garnered 104 voting points to land second, while Bryan (Tenn.) picked up two first-place votes to come in third with 102 points. 
The remaining first-place vote went to Milligan (Tenn.), which registers in fourth with 83 voting points. Point (Ga.) rounds out the top five as it collected 82 points. 
Reinhardt (Ga.) (77 points), Bluefield (Va.) (53), St. Andrews (N.C.) (37), Truett-McConnell (Ga.) (33), Columbia (S.C.) (28) and Montreat (N.C.) (20) make up the rest of the field. 
Returning for their senior seasons in hope of adding another championship to their collection, Lydia Nash (SR/Florence, Ky.) and Haley Perkins (SR/Glasgow, Ky.) will look to lead the Bulldogs back to the NAIA National Tournament. Last season, Nash and Perkins were named to the AAC First-Team, while Perkins earned an AAC All-Defensive Team nod. The duo also earned WBCA All-American Honorable Mention honors. 
Nash averaged 16.8 points per game, ranking 46th in NAIA Division II. Perkins averaged 12.9 points per game and 8.0 rebounds per game. She collected 83 steals on the season, while ranking 14th nationally in steals per game with 2.96, a new school record. 
The Bulldogs will open the 2015-16 season on the road at Alice Lloyd (Ky.) on Nov. 10, before returning home to host the Union College Classic Nov. 13-14. In the classic, Union will host Midway (Ky.) and Alice Lloyd. 
The AAC Tournament is set for Feb. 24-27, 2016, at the MeadowView Marriott Conference Resort & Convention Center in Kingsport, Tenn. 
2015-16 AAC Women's Basketball Preseason PollSchool (1st Place Votes) Points 
1. Union (2) 1072. Tennessee Wesleyan (6) 1043. Bryan (2) 102
